snippet.title: A: What does '/ operator do in MATLAB?

snippet.title: A: What does '/ operator do in MATLAB?
snippet.description: As Brandon said, ' is the conjugate or Hermitian transpose (also known as linear algebraic transpose), and .' is the array transpose. For more information see MATLAB's Arithmetic Operators page. …

snippet.title: A: The complex conjugate transpose in Mathematica
snippet.description: [a] Output: {{3 + 2 I, 1 - I}, {2 - 5 I, 4 + 3 I}} {{3 - 2 I, 2 + 5 I}, {1 + I, 4 - 3 I}} You can also use the Hermitian conjugate symbol, which you use by entering esc hc esc or \\[HermitianConjugate]. … In your title you ask for conjugate transpose. That's just ConjugateTranspose. If you want the conjugate, it's just Conjugate. Input: a = {{3 + 2 I, 1 - I}, {2 - 5 I, 4 + 3 I}} ConjugateTranspose …

snippet.title: Q: Algorithm for fast vector-vector (a * a^H) multiplication?
snippet.description: The vector a containing complex numbers is of size N-by-1. The task is to find the matrix A (N-by-N) obtained by multiplication a * a^H, where H is the Hermitian operator (conjugate-transpose), so … that matrix A is Hermitian. Is there any algorithm to do this faster than O(N^2)? (except that only half the matrix can be computed). Can the divide and conquer approach be applied here somehow? …

snippet.title: A: Confusions about Multiplication of Complex Value in MatLab
snippet.description: The operator ' is the also called Complex conjugate transpose in Matlab ctranspose, which basically means that it applies conj and and transpose functions. Note that this operator is call Hermitian … operator in mathematics. What you actually want is the operator transpose that is shortcut as .' Also, remember that the operator ' is the hermitian operator … , namely, conjugated of the transposed, whereas .' is simply transposition, which you could also get by transpose(A). Hence, the transform for negative frequencies … is the conjugate of the corresponding samples for positive frequencies.
